content.description:
Currently this is a TR. Follow bolts (without hangers) starting on the left side. The first moves feel like 9+. Move up using the left arete then right and up on small tweakers to reach first ledge. Locate next bolt near center, and continue up to small ledge. The next moves are very thin high step 11- if you stay on face, otherwise step right around corner for 10 climbing, then continue moving back left to the second ledge.

Climb up a third tier starting in the middle trending right after 15-20 feet to an arete then to the top. When climbing on third tier, your belayer will typically not be able to see you and may believe you're at the top. You may want to remind them how much climbing is left.
content.protection: A toprope. If you bring 2 hangers and a wrench, you will be able to rap from the bolts on top, or walk off to right (upstream).
content.location: On the left side of Bullshit Rock is a gully and another three tier cliff with a route on it on which the bolt hangers have been removed. The bolts and nuts are still there. The guidebook says this is low quality route, but it is a good TR with some quality climbing.

content.description: Climb an arete. At a dihedral, keep your hands low and feet high before reaching up. The guidebook says 10b but maybe not. Above the dihedral, stay left for easier climbing to the top. Diagonaling right are small edges, and the climbing is more difficult.
content.protection: A standard rack. Near the base there is hidden 2" crack on the left side.
content.location: On left side of crag, follow an arete from the base to the top.

content.description: Climb up a ramp on the right side to the overhang, traverse to gain the top of then overhang, then move up, following thin crack in middle of face. Above upper ledge the climbing does not back off.
content.protection: A SR with an emphasis on small pro.
content.location: In center of crag is the route, you'll probably want to TR this before leading.

content.description:
Go up a dirty ramp, step left to an overhang, stem right to clip a bolt, and do moderate stem to gain a small ledge clipping a second bolt. Clipping the third bolt is the crux. So using a sport QD, you may be able to clip from the ledge, otherwise you'll need to smear while making this exciting clip, but there is a bolt just below you so it's pretty safe.

Continue up cracks and seams to the top. At the top, find a two bolt rap anchor. We added sling-age and a rap carabiner on Feb. 29, 2020

From the base of the climb, the headwall will appear foreshortened. Don't be fooled, you will need plenty of protection past the third bold. I probably placed 8 pieces above the bolts.
content.location: On the right side of the rightmost crag above river far below Wailing Wall, there is an overhang with a block sticking out in the middle of the crag partway up.

pathTokens: South Fork of St. Vrain Canyon
